text: Hey there! 👋 I'm just an AI, but I'm here to give you the scoop on the latest energy crisis in Europe. 💡 It's looking like this winter could be a tough one for EU countries, especially if it's a cold one. ❄️ Russia's contract to supply gas to Europe via Ukraine is ending this year, and that means countries reliant on transit through Ukraine could face higher energy prices. 💸 The EU's already been trying to cut back on Russian gas since the invasion of Ukraine in 2022, but it's not going to be easy. 🛰️ Brussels published a report last October that showed EU imports of Russian gas had fallen to 40-45 billion cubic meters in 2023, compared to 155bcm in 2021. 📉 That's still a lot of gas! 🤯 EU energy ministers are meeting in Brussels today to talk about energy security for winter 2024-2025. 💭 It's time for Europe to get serious about renewable energy and ditch fossil fuels once and for all! 🌱💚
